Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm roads closures will be in place on sections of Ballast Point Rd, Brent St, Darling St, Evan St, Joseph St, Hartley St, Hanover St, Loughlin St, Mackenzie St, Mansfield St, McKell St, Mullen St, Rose St, Terry St, The Crescent, Waragal Ave, Wharf Rd and Yeend St.
  • There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for Balmain Access Permit holders on select roads with passes, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles only. Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.
  • From 8.30pm to 9.30pm and from 11pm to 12.30am Anzac Bridge citybound lanes will be closed. The Sydney Harbour Bridge will remain closed to general traffic until 1.30am.

Special event clearways are in effect on Victoria Rd from The Crescent, Rozelle to Westbourne St, Drummoyne (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD. From 1pm extended no-parking bus zones will be in effect on sections of Darling St and Grove St, and no-stopping zones will be in effect on sections of Montague St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

  • Sections of Macquarie Rd, College St, Cathedral St, Hospital Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and St James Rd will be closed from 9:30pm.

Parking in the area is limited and expected to reach capacity early. A dedicated drop-off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - New Year's Eve 2023

properties.publicTransport: Transport services will be affected by road closures. From 3pm there will be no direct access to Circular Quay, you'll need to continue on foot to the harbour. Visit transportnsw.info/sydney-nye for all the details you need to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The city is no place for cars on New Year’s Eve with significant road closures and parking restrictions in effect across the city, North Sydney, Milsons Point and Pyrmont. In the Sydney CBD, some roads start closing from as early as 4am with roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks closed by 2pm, followed by major closures in the city centre and Pyrmont by 7pm.

The Cahill Expressway southbound lanes 7 and 8 on the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay Overpass will close from 6am on NYE. The Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions from 11pm ahead of the midnight fireworks. The Anzac Bridge citybound lanes will close from 8.30pm to 9.30pm and again from 11pm to 1.30am for both firework displays.

The Cahill walkway will close from 6am while the Sydney Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway will close from 6pm.

Most roads in the city reopen between 1.30am and 4am on New Year's Day.

Key road closures:

  • 4am – 6am: Macquarie St north of Bridge St to the Sydney Opera House.
  • 5am – 4am: Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd in the Royal Botanic Garden & Domain.
  • 6am – 10am (1 Jan): Circular Quay West and George St between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd
  • 6am – 4am: Cahill Expressway southbound lanes 7 + 8 on the Harbour Bridge and overpass at Circular Quay. Use the Harbour Bridge or Tunnel instead for travel to and from the east. Note Harbour Bridge will close from 11pm-1.30am for the midnight fireworks.
  • 10am – 4am: Macquarie St between Bridge St and Shakespeare Place, Bridge St at Macquarie St and Phillip Lane
  • 12pm – 4am: Hickson Rd between Towns Place, Millers Point and Watermans Quay, Barangaroo, and Barton St.
  • 2pm – 4am: roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks north of Bridge St/Grosvenor St including George St/Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Bridge St at Loftus St, Phillip St, Young St, Pitt St, Loftus St, Lower Fort St,, Harrington St, Argyle St, Upper Fort St and other local roads.
  • 5pm – 4am: Grosvenor St off-ramp from Harbour Bridge and Bridge St between Grosvenor St and Loftus St. At Central, the Railway Colonnade will close.
  • 6pm – 4am: Darling Island Rd at Pyrmont.
  • 7pm – 4am: Major roads in the CBD centre from Wynyard to Hyde Park including Macquarie St, Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St, Pitt St, King St, Bent St, Hunter St, Market St, Park St, Druitt St, roads in Millers Point including sections of Hickson Rd, Towns Place, Dalgety Rd, Wheat Rd at King St Wharf and Pirrama Rd in Pyrmont.
  • From 7pm the only way to travel east/west across the city is via Goulburn St or the Cross City Tunnel.
  • From the Harbour Bridge there will be no access to Harbour St at Darling Harbour. Use York St or Glebe Off-ramps.
  • 8pm – 1.30am: Darling Drive from Pyrmont Bridge Rd to Pier St at Darling Harbour.
  • 8.30pm - 9.30pm: citybound lanes on the Anzac Bridge and Western Distributor. No access to the city, use local detours via Rozelle and Glebe. The Rozelle Interchange tunnel citybound lanes and exits to Rozelle will also be closed from 8.30pm to 1.30am
  • 10pm – 1.30am: roads in Millers Point including sections of Kent St, Windmill St, High St, Argyle St and Lower Fort St.
  • 10pm – 4am: roads between Wynyard and Town Hall including sections of York St and Clarence St between Margaret St and Druitt St. No direct access from Harbour Bridge into the city from 10pm-11pm, motorists will be diverted via Western Distributor. Motorists heading east should use the Harbour Tunnel.
  • 11pm – 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions, Anzac Bridge closed citybound, and Western Distributor fully closed between Pyrmont and the city. Roads in CBD West also closed including Sussex St and Kent St, and all roads in King St Wharf/Barangaroo.
  • 11pm – 4am: closures in CBD South around Hyde Park including sections of Liverpool, Pitt, Castlereagh and Elizabeth Streets. At Central, Eddy Ave will close including local roads.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on majority of roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont from 6am NYE until 4am NYD. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator..

properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market 36-hour trading period will start from 5am Saturday 23 December to 5pm on Christmas Eve, Sunday 24 December.

Heavy traffic is expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area surrounding the Fish Market.

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Parking is available at Sydney Fish Market car park, access via Bank St, and also nearby at Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers, particularly if car parks are at capacity.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.

Roads along the waterfront in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and Blues Point start closing the night before on Friday 30 December.

On New Year's Eve roads key roads in North Sydney CBD close from 3pm follow by major closures in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay from 5pm. Roads will reopen by 3am on 1 January.

Key road closure timings:

  • 7pm 30 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: roads around vantage points in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will close including Olympic Dr, Broughton St and Henry Lawson Ave.
  • 6am 31 Dec – 4am 1 Jan: the Cahill Expressway southbound lanes on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and overpass at Circular Quay. Use the Sydney Harbour Bridge or Tunnel instead for travel to and from the east. Note Harbour Bridge will close from 11pm-1.30am for the midnight fireworks.

  • 3pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: Blue St at North Sydney Station.
  • 5pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: major closures in North Sydney and surrounds including Alfred St South, Lavender St, Blues Point Rd, Bay Rd, Union St, Woolcott St, Miller St, Pacific Hwy southbound and surrounding local roads in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay, Waverton and Kirribilli closed
  • 8pm 31 Dec - 3am 1 Jan: Pacific Hwy off-ramp to North Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge closed. Use the Miller St or Military Rd off-ramps instead for access to North Sydney.
  • 11pm to 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions including access from Arthur St in North Sydney.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 1pm NYE and 3am NYD. On some streets clearways in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will be in effect from 7pm 30 Dec.

Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A series of concerts will be held at the Sydney Opera House forecourt with thousands of fans expected to attend each show.

  • Wed 6 to Friday 8 Dec - Dermot Kennedy
  • Sat 9 Dec - Synthony
  • Sun 10 and Mon 11 Dec - Guy Sebastian
  • Tue 12 Dec - Ice House
  • Wed 13 Dec - Human Nature

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected along Macquarie St and Bridge St approaching the Opera House car park and drop off area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Road and cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 car park will not be open for this match.
  • Closures may be in place on the Moore Park Rd / Fitzroy St cycleway before and after the game to allow for the safe movement of pedestrians to and from the stadium.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport:
Event attendees are encouraged to use public transport, with North Wollongong station located a short walk from the venue.

Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5000 attendees are expected for the North Gong Pub Santa Pub Crawl on Saturday 10 December.

1 of 3 southbound lanes will be closed on the Princes Highway at North Wollongong with a reduced 40km/h speed limit.

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed and allow extra travel time.
properties.displayName: North Gong Hotel Santa Pub Crawl

webLinks.linkText: Let the Good Times Roll Festival

properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling Sets Music Festival will be held on Saturday 9 December at Entrance Memorial Park with up to 8000 attendees expected. Let the Good Times Roll Festival will be held at the same location on Sunday 10 December with up to 5000 concert goers anticipated.


Marine Parade from Beach Street to Duffys Lane will be closed on Saturday from 10am to 10pm and on Sunday from 11.30am to 8pm.
properties.diversions: Local road detours will be in place with traffic management.

properties.otherAdvice:
Speed reduction and stop slow traffic control will be in place at various locations along Kosciuszko Road between Jindabyne and Charlottes Pass

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed, allow extra travel time and exercise caution as there will be participants on foot.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Ingham Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:20pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Foo Fighters concert at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open at 4:15pm, main act from 8pm, finish around 11pm.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct as a combined crowd of more than 100,000 is expected to attend multiple events in Olympic Park across the evening.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

CAR PARKS SOLD OUT: all car parks in Olympic Park are sold out for Saturday 9 December. If you have not pre-booked a space, do not drive – there will be no parking available on site. You will need to catch public transport.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.
